Lydia Shum Din-ha or Lydia Tin Ha Sum (Chinese: 沈殿霞; 21 July 1945–19 February 2008) was a Hong Kong comic, MC, actress, and singer specially recognized for her signature darkish rimmed glasses and bouffant coiffure. Shum debuted in When the Peach Blossoms Bloom, a 1960 Mandarin comedy directed by way of Griffin Yueh Feng. [3] She took some time to alter to Hong Kong as she found the neighborhood Cantonese cuisine very one of a kind from that of her native Shanghai.[citation needed] While she worked at Shaw Brothers, her reputation grew and she or he became one of the first stakeholders within the up-and-coming tv broadcast station TVB. In 1967, Shum’s stardom took off with the popular range show Enjoy Yourself Tonight. She first sang inside the Cantopop organization, the Four Golden Flowers. Later, she played a Shanghai woman in the Nineteen Seventies. She also sang because the associate of Roman Tam from 1971 to 1973.[citation needed]
